KALE PAKORAS - CRISPY CHICKPEA FLOUR FRITTERS - GLUTEN-FREE BAKED

Get the WRITTEN RECIPE here: https://www.veganricha.com/kale-pakora-recipe/

SUBSCRIBE HERE: https://www.youtube.com/veganricharecipes?sub_confirmation=1

Baked Kale Pakora. Pakoras or Pakoda are fried Crispy Indian fritters which are served for snacking. Use other greens such as spinach for Spinach Pakora or chard for variation. Gluten-free, soy-free, nut-free, and vegan.

Pakoras are a frequent snack especially around the festive season. People visit friends and family with a collection of sweets and snacks, hang out and eat fresh pakoras and drink masala chai!

recipeIngredient: 1 cup chickpea flour ((garbanzo bean flour. If using besan, add 2 to 4 tbsp more for thicker batter consistency))
3 tbsp rice flour ((or use fine semolina. Semolina is not gluten-free))
1/2 tsp cumin seeds (, or other spices of choice such as carom seeds, mustard seeds, sesame seeds)
1  red or green chili (, finely chopped)
1   bunch of curly kale (5 to 6 medium stems , 3+ cups packed after chopping )

recipeInstructions.text: Remove stems from the kale by pulling between your fingers, or by using a knife. Chop into small pieces. Preheat the oven to 425 deg F (218 C). Line a baking sheet or dish with parchment.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove stems from the kale by pulling between your fingers, or by using a knife. Chop into small pieces. Preheat the oven to 425 deg F (218 C). Line a baking sheet or dish with parchment.

recipeInstructions.text: Make the batter: Add all the dry ingredients into a bowl and mix. Add oil if using and water and whisk to make a thick smooth batter. If the batter is too thin/watery, add more chickpea flour a few tsp at a time and whisk in. If too thick, add water (1-2 tbsp). You want the batter to be thick and close to pasty so that it sticks well to the leaves.

If the batter is too thin/watery, add more chickpea flour a few tsp at a time and whisk in. If too thick, add water (1-2 tbsp). You want the batter to be thick and close to pasty so that it sticks well to the leaves.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the kale to the batter, and mix and rub the batter on/between the leaves
recipeInstructions.name: Add the kale to the batter, and mix and rub the batter on/between the leaves

recipeInstructions.text: Spread on parchment lined sheet, and bake at 425 degrees for a total of 18-28 minutes. Bake time depends on the size of the kale, and how crisp you'd like it to be. Reduce temp to 375 degrees F (190 C) after 22 minutes. Move the dish around for even baking.

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle some chaat masala or cayenne(red chili powder) Serve with green chutney, or tamarind chutney!Store: on the counter for the day.
